data.title: SlowDive Diving Into Their New Tour To Celebrate 5th Album ' Everything Is Alive' -
data.meta_description: Slowdive, a British rock band that was formed in Reading, England, just released the dates for their 2023-2024 tour. Slowdive will be touring across 15 countries and have 47 upcoming concerts to celebrate their recent album release, ‘Everything is Alive.’ Starting with Toronto, Canada, at Queen Elizabeth
data.text:
Rieli Lettsome September 13th, 2023 - 8:30 PM

Slowdive, a British rock band that was formed in Reading, England, just released the dates for their 2023-2024 tour. Slowdive will be touring across 15 countries and have 47 upcoming concerts to celebrate their recent album release, ‘Everything is Alive.’ Starting with Toronto, Canada, at Queen Elizabeth Theatre, Slowdive was formed in 1989 by two childhood best friends, Neil Halstead and Rachel Goswell. They came up with the name Slowdive from a word in a dream of bass player Nick Chaplin. They both sang and played guitar together since they were six years old. Slowdive plays a broad genre of music, from folk-rock to ambient techno music. The band likes to use a significant amount of guitar in their music and funeral tempos, as well as some vocals. The band’s music fits with what they say in British “shoegazing,” where they use heavy use of effects of pedals. Slowdive started with their debut album ‘Just for a Day’ which was released in 1991; since then, Slowdive has released over five studio albums, three compilation albums, five extended plays, five singles, and four music videos.

The band did take a twenty-year hiatus after releasing their album Pygmalion in 1995. They took a break due to some band members leaving, but they returned together in 2017 for a self-titled album. Their much recent album just came out on September 1, 2023. Don’t miss out on seeing this excellent band play in Chicago on October 3rd at The Riviera Theatre; get your tickets on Ticketmaster.com or on their website.

Tour dates

September 23: Toronto, ON – Queen Elizabeth Theatre

September 25: Boston, MA – Citizens House of Blues Boston
